article:
In statistics, 'aggregate data' describes data combined from several
measurements. When you aggregate data, you replace groups of observations with
summary statistics based on those observations. [http://www.r-bloggers.com/aggregation-and-restructuring-
data-from-%E2%80%9Cr-in-action%E2%80%9D/#more-891 Aggregation and Restructuring
of data] (chapter 5.6 from the book "R in Action", Manning Publications)

In economics, 'aggregate data' or 'data aggregates' describes high-level data
that is composed from a multitude or combination of other more individual data.
*in macroeconomics data such as the overall price level or overall inflation
rate *in microeconomics data of an entire sector of an economy composed of many
firms, or of all households in a city or region.
